location: The same. A  street near the gate.

lines.text: Enter SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and an AEdile

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Bid them all home hes gone, and well no further. The nobility are vexd, whom we see have sided In his behalf.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Now we have shown our power, Let us seem humbler after it is done Than when it was adoing.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Bid them home: Say their great enemy is gone, and they Stand in their ancient strength.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Dismiss them home. Here comes his mother.
Exit AEdile

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Lets not meet her.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Why

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: They say shes mad.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: They have taen note of us: keep on your way.
Enter VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, and MENENIUS

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: O, yere well met: the hoarded plague o the gods Requite your love!

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: Peace, peace be not so loud.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: If that I could for weeping, you should hear, Nay, and you shall hear some. Will you be gone
To BRUTUS

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: [To SICINIUS]  You shall stay too: I would I had the power To say so to my husband.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Are  you mankind

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Ay, fool is that a shame Note but this fool. Was not a man my father Hadst thou foxship To banish him that struck more blows for Rome Than thou hast spoken words

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: O blessed heavens!

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: More noble blows than ever thou wise words And for Romes good. Ill tell thee what yet go: Nay, but thou shalt stay too: I would my son Were in Arabia, and thy tribe before him, His good sword in his hand.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: What then

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: What then! Held make an end of thy posterity.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Bastards and all. Good man, the wounds that he does bear for Rome!

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: Come, come, peace.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: I would he had continued to his country As he began, and not unknit himself The noble knot he made.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: I would he had.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: I would he had! Twas you incensed the rabble: Cats, that can judge as fitly of his worth As I can of those mysteries which heaven Will not have earth to know.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Pray, let us go.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Now, pray, sir, get you gone: You have done a brave deed. Ere you go, hear this: As far as doth the Capitol exceed The meanest house in Rome, so far my son This ladys husband here, this, do you see Whom you have banishd, does exceed you all.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Well, well, well leave you.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Why stay we to be baited With one that wants her wits

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Take my prayers with you. I would the gods had nothing else to do But to confirm my curses! Could I meet em But once aday, it would unclog my heart Of what lies heavy tot.
Exeunt Tribunes

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: You have told them home And, by my troth, you have cause. Youll sup with me

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Angers my meat I sup upon myself, And so shall starve with feeding. Come, lets go: Leave this faint puling and lament as I do, In anger, Junolike. Come, come, come.

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: Fie, fie, fie!
Exeunt
